sentences.sContent: Jack Kennedy embodied all the hopes of the 1960s.
sentences.sCn: 杰克•肯尼迪体现了20世纪60年代的全部希望。

sentences.sContent: For twenty-nine years, Checkpoint Charlie embodied the Cold War.
sentences.sCn: 29年来，查理检查站具体象征了冷战。

synos.tran: 体现，使具体化；具体表达

remMethod.val: em(给予) + body(形体) → 给予形体 → 使有形 → 体现

trans.tranOther: To embody an idea or quality means to be a symbol or expression of that idea or quality
